page.title: 18NORTHCOTT BARTON, NR BEAFORD
page.content: Northcott Barton is the name of our farmhouse. It is 3 miles from Beaford, 3 miles from dolton and 8 miles from Torrington. Its age is not known but there was a settlement here in the thirteenth century. The dining room has two beams stretching right across the room. The ceiling is coated with limewash which makes it hard to paper. The house is made of cob, stone and some bricks, and was thatched before the present tiled roof was installed. The house is a Devonshire Longhouse. Above the living room was the granary where corn was once ground. Some of our barns date back to the first Elizabeth. At the back of the house is a room called the pumphouse, which once supplied the water, but the pump no longer exists. Northcott means north of the wood, and near the house is Arson Wood.
